Package io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.target

Interface ISyncTarget

public interface ISyncTarget
Interface to implement for each synchronization target.

This is the main interface to implement for each target to synchronize with. It maps all data for assets from Smint.io to the target DAM.

Transmit assets from Smint.io to any DAM (one-way)

The purpose of instances of this interface is to store assets, bought on Smint.io to the target downstream Asset Management System (DAM). Smint.io is a purchase platform to easy acquiring of digital assets. These assets then can be stored with a local DAM. Instances implementing this interface support automatically storing of assets from Smint.io to a target DAM - in a one-way process, from Smint.io to DAM (Smint.io -->> DAM).

Assets contain two kind of data sets

The data for assets contain two kind of data sets:

  • Binary data of the asset, like image data.
  • Meta data containing license data, names, tags, description, etc. - all localized if possible.

So, when transmitting assets to the target DAM, all these data sets are transmitted. Usually the data hardly change, but updates must be possible for legal reasons and legal obligations. The same apply to licenses of assets. Licenses on assets won't change, a snapshot is created upon purchase of the asset. However, there might be legal obligations to change the license after purchase. Thus it must be possible to do so.

Two-phased synchronization process

At first, structured meta data is synchronized, containing all kinds of meta data types, asset types, licenses, etc. (see beforeGenericMetadataSync(), afterGenericMetadataSync()). Then binary assets are synchronized (see beforeAssetsSync(), afterAssetsSync()). This will ensure, all required meta data types and values are available on the target before the binaries are transmitted. This is necessary, as meta data information on assets are linked to the assets via target DAM's IDs, to make it easier for the target DAM to store it without the hassle to perform a database lookup first for each meta data item.

During synchronization of the meta data, an internal mapping of meta data's Smint.io API keys and sync target IDs are created. This mapping is vital for feeding the meta data sync target UUID to the assets to reference these values. This mapping is kept in memory as long as the synchronization is being scheduled. Nevertheless if this mapping is missing, a meta data sync is enforced to create it, even on push notification driven sync.

Event driven notification for start and end of sync phases

The synchronization process is triggered by external events. Implementing classes get notified of occurring events, like the start of a sync process (see beforeSync()) or its ending (see afterSync()). Each phase of the sync process create such events. At every start of a phase (see beforeGenericMetadataSync(), beforeAssetsSync()) instances may abort the synchronization process immediately. At the end of every phase (see afterGenericMetadataSync(), afterAssetsSync()) instances may perform some clean-up.

Two ways to trigger a synchronization process

There are two ways how a synchronization is triggered, as outlined in ISmintIoSynchronization. A scheduled synchronization and synchronization because of receiving a push notification for new purchases.

Parallel execution of imports

When implementing a class, beware that all independent meta data may be imported in parallel by different threads. Please do not impose blocking of multiple threads to the implementing class. Instead support calling different imports by different threads at the same time and synchronize on the data level.
Especially calling importBinaryTypes(ISmintIoMetadataElement[]) and importContentTypes(ISmintIoMetadataElement[]) could be parallelized as these handle distinct, independent content.

Importing meta data information - set sync target ID on meta data item

Meta data is imported in categories, whereas each category will receive a list of Smint.io values as instances of ISmintIoMetadataElement. The ISmintIoMetadataElement.getKey() of the list item will return the Smint.io API key for that item and the ISmintIoMetadataElement.getValues() will hold a list of localized names for that item. The localized name can be used with the UI.

The list is not sorted in any way. See an example with JSON.

Set sync target ID on meta data item

For each Smint.io key (see ISmintIoMetadataElement.getKey()) a sync target ID must be created and stored with the meta data element by setting it to ISmintIoMetadataElement.setTargetMetadataUuid(String). This sync target ID will be used with assets to import or update as references to the meta data item.

Although very rare, updates to the meta data may occur for legal reasons or legal obligations. So always update the data in the sync target, overwriting with the new values supplied by Smint.io. In such case the Smint.io key already exists, just update/overwrite the localized names retrieved by ISmintIoMetadataElement.getValues() and call ISmintIoMetadataElement.setTargetMetadataUuid(String) passing the already existing target ID. Implementing classes must not create new sync target ID if the data already exists and is updated. This would lead to big mess with the meta data, as the strictly 1:1 relation between these keys would be broken.

IMPORTANT! a valid ID must be set to ISmintIoMetadataElement.setTargetMetadataUuid(String). After an import of meta data, each meta data element will be checked for valid target UUID. If that is missing, the synchronization will immediately abort with an exception. These target UUIDs are vital! So for every import of meta data items, something like the following pseudo-code should be used (see importContentProviders(ISmintIoMetadataElement[])): 


    void importContentProviders(final ISmintIoMetadataElement[] contentProviders) {

        if (contentProviders == null || contentProviders.length == 0) {
            return;
        }


        for (final ISmintIoMetadataElement metadataToImport : contentProviders) {
            if (metadataToImport == null) {
                continue;
            }

            final String contentProviderSmintIoID = metadataToImport.getKey();
            final Map<Locale, String> localizedNameOfProviderForUIDisplay =  metadataToImport.getValues();

            // NOW import the key and its UI translation for each content provider
            // store the data somewhere - the storage should return an ID to
            // find this value again.


            // finished storing this data ..
            final String myIdOfThisMetaDataElement = .....
            metadataToImport.setTargetMetadataUuid(myIdOfThisMetaDataElement);
        }
    }

Whenever meta data is synchronized, *ALL* data will be written to the sync target. At the moment Smint.io does not support deleting any meta data information, as it might break data of assets still referring to it. Nevertheless passing all data will enable sync targets to detect for deleted meta data. However, implementors must not delete keys on sync target that are not passed to the importing functions without any checks, whether they are still used or referred to. Doing so could break meta information of assets. So, upon importing meta data, expect to come across already existing Smint.io keys. This is perfectly natural and expected behavior.

  • Method Details

    • getCapabilities

      ISyncTargetCapabilities getCapabilities()
      Provides information about features this sync target supports and thus is capable of.
      Returns:
      Must not return null but always a valid instance!

    • beforeSync

      boolean beforeSync()
      A hook to be called before any synchronization is started in this turn.

      This hook is called right before any synchronization takes place. If some preparations or are to be made in advance, a task must be returned. If synchronization does not need to be prepared or any status checked or altered, then simply return an empty task, doing nothing.

      Although this task is executed in an asynchronous way, synchronization is only started after this tasks ends successfully. In case the tasks aborts, crashes or ends unsuccessfully, synchronization is terminated immediately with proper logging. Such ending usually is indicated by throwing an exception.

      Any exception thrown will indicate a faulty ending, immediately aborting the overall synchronization. So make sure all exceptions to be ignored are caught within the task.

      Returns:
      A boolean value, indicating whether to continue synchronization or not. true means, synchronization will continue, whereas false aborts the sync task without further notice.

    • beforeGenericMetadataSync

      boolean beforeGenericMetadataSync()
      Is called right before the generic meta data is about to be synced but after beforeSync().

      This hook is only called in case the generic meta data is to be synchronized. Usually this is done on a regular and scheduled basis. Additionally to a re-scheduled background task for synchronization asset content is synced on demand - without any generic meta data.

      In case the tasks returns false synchronization of generic meta data is aborted immediately. However, if the mapping of meta data Smint.io API IDs and sync target UUIDs is missing, synchronizing meta data is enforced anyway. In this case the return value is simply ignored. This happens on each first run of the synchronization. Later runs make use of already existing mapping, which is cached internally.

      In case the task crashes with an exception, overall synchronization is terminated without syncing any asset.

      Any exception thrown will indicate a faulty ending, immediately aborting the overall synchronization. So make sure all exceptions to be ignored are caught within the task.

      Returns:
      A boolean value, indicating whether to continue meta data synchronization or not. true means, synchronization will continue, whereas false aborts the sync task without further notice and without calling afterGenericMetadataSync().

    • importContentProviders

      void importContentProviders(ISmintIoMetadataElement[] contentProviders)
      Import the provided list of content providers.

      For general information about meta data import, see Import Meta Data Information in the heading section above. Example data for this meta data category is: 

       [
     {
         "getKey": "getty",
         "getValues": {
             "en": "Getty Images",
             "de": "Getty Images"
         }
     },
     {
         "getKey": "istock",
         "getValues": {
             "en": "iStock",
             "de": "iStock"
         }
     },
     {
         "getKey": "shutterstock",
         "getValues": {
             "en": "Shutterstock",
             "de": "Shutterstock"
         }
     },
     {
         "getKey": "adobestock",
         "getValues": {
             "en": "Adobe Stock",
             "de": "Adobe Stock"
         }
     },
     {
         "getKey": "panthermedia",
         "getValues()": {
             "en": "PantherMedia",
             "de": "PantherMedia"
         }
     }
 ]

      The synchronizations's target IDs must be set to each meta data element with ISmintIoMetadataElement.setTargetMetadataUuid(String). Otherwise the sync job will bail out.

      Parameters:
      contentProviders - the list of content providers used with Smint.io.

    • importContentTypes

      void importContentTypes(ISmintIoMetadataElement[] contentTypes)

      For general information about meta data import, see Import Meta Data Information in the heading section above. Example data for this meta data category is: 

       [
     {
         "getKey": "image",
         "getValues": {
             "en": "Image",
             "de": "Bild"
         }
     },
     {
         "getKey": "video",
         "getValues": {
             "en": "Video",
             "de": "Video"
         }
     },
     {
         "getKey": "audio",
         "getValues": {
             "en": "Audio",
             "de": "Audio"
         }
     },
     {
         "getKey": "document",
         "getValues": {
             "en": "Text",
             "de": "Text"
         }
     },
     {
         "getKey": "template",

             "en": "Template",
             "de": "Vorlage"
         }
     },

         "getKey": "3d",

             "en": "3D",
             "de": "3D"
         }
     }
 ]

      The synchronizations's target IDs must be set to each meta data element with ISmintIoMetadataElement.setTargetMetadataUuid(String). Otherwise the sync job will bail out.

      Parameters:
      contentTypes - the list of content types used with Smint.io.

    • importLicenseLanguages

      void importLicenseLanguages(ISmintIoMetadataElement[] licenseLanguages)
      Import the provided list of languages a license for an asset is restricted to.

      The usage of assets may be limited to certain languages or certain languages may be excluded. Smint.io keeps a list of all languages ever used within licensing on the platform as meta data. This list is provided here and linked to if such a restriction is applicable.

      For general information about meta data import, see Import Meta Data Information in the heading section above. Example data for this meta data category is: 

       [
     {
         "Key": "ara",
         "Values": {
             "de": "Arabisch",
             "en": "Arabic"
         }
     },
     {
         "Key": "rus",
         "Values": {
             "de": "Russisch",
             "en": "Russian"
         }
     },
     {
         "Key": "ben",
         "Values": {
             "de": "Bengali",
             "en": "Bengali"
         }
     },
     {
         "Key": "eng",
         "Values": {
             "de": "Englisch",
             "en": "English"
         }
     },
     {
         "Key": "spa",
         "Values": {
             "de": "Spanisch",
             "en": "Spanish"
         }
     },
     {
         "Key": "hns",
         "Values": {
             "de": "Hindi",
             "en": "Hindustani"
         }
     },
     {
         "Key": "fra",
         "Values": {
             "de": "Franzsisch",
             "en": "French"
         }
     },
     {
         "Key": "ger",
         "Values": {
             "de": "Deutsch",
             "en": "German"
         }
     },
     {
         "Key": "cmn",
         "Values": {
             "de": "Mandarin",
             "en": "Mandarin"
         }
     },
     {
         "Key": "any",
         "Values": {
             "de": "Alle",
             "en": "Any"
         }
     },
     {
         "Key": "por",
         "Values": {
             "de": "Portugiesisch",
             "en": "Portuguese"
         }
     },
     {
         "Key": "msa",
         "Values": {
             "de": "Malaysisch",
             "en": "Malay"
         }
     }
 ]

      Each ISmintIoMetadataElement.getKey() will return a valid ISO 639-3 code. Smint.io uses other codes internally with its RESTful API but these codes are translated to their ISO counterparts by this library.
      Although this library is delivering the same localized text as used with Smint.io web page, it would be better to use the name, available to your system - if there is some. So to get the proper localized name from "Mandarin" by using something like new Locale("cmn").getDisplayLanguage(). However there might not be translations for all languages available with your Java VM. So either use the values provided here, or use an external library for such cases.

      Parameters:
      licenseLanguages - the list of languages a license may restrict the usage of assets to.

    • importLicenseUsageLimits

      void importLicenseUsageLimits(ISmintIoMetadataElement[] licenseUsageLimits)

    • afterGenericMetadataSync

      void afterGenericMetadataSync()
      After the synchronization of all generic meta data this is called, before any syncing of assets.

      This hook is only called in case the generic meta data has been synchronized without any exception.

      Any exception thrown will indicate a faulty ending, immediately aborting the overall synchronization. So make sure all exceptions to be ignored are caught within the task.

    • beforeAssetsSync

      boolean beforeAssetsSync()
      Is called right before assets are about to be synced but after beforeSync() and after afterGenericMetadataSync().

      This hook is only called right before any assets are to be synced.

      Any exception thrown will indicate a faulty ending, immediately aborting the overall synchronization. So make sure all exceptions to be ignored are caught within the task.

      Returns:
      A boolean value, indicating whether to continue asset synchronization or not. true means, synchronization will continue, whereas false aborts the sync task without further notice and without calling afterAssetsSync() or afterSync().

    • getTargetCompoundAssetUuid

      String getTargetCompoundAssetUuid(String assetUuid)
      Maps the Smint.io ID of a Compound Asset to a synchronization target ID/key.
      Parameters:
      assetUuid - the ID of the compound asset on the Smint.io platform.
      Returns:
      the key on the synchronization target, or null in case the element does not exist yet on the target.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if parameter is null.
      See Also:
      • BaseSyncAsset

    • getTargetAssetBinaryUuid

      String getTargetAssetBinaryUuid(String assetTransactionUuid, String binaryUuid)
      Maps the Smint.io ID of a Binary Asset to a synchronization target ID/key.
      Parameters:
      assetTransactionUuid - the ID of the asset on the Smint.io platform.
      binaryUuid - the ID of the binary data on the Smint.io platform.
      Returns:
      the key on the synchronization target, or null in case the element does not exist yet on the target.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if parameter is null.
      See Also:
      • BaseSyncAsset

    • importNewTargetAssets

      void importNewTargetAssets(BaseSyncAsset[] newTargetAssets)
      Stores new entries for assets on the synchronization target, these must be created on the target.

      Creating new entries is only called for new assets available on the Smin.io platform but not yet on the sync target. Implementing classes can be sure, these items do not exist yet and do not need to perform any checks for duplicates.

      Parameters:
      newTargetAssets - the list of new assets to create on the sync target. Ignore in case the list is empty ore null.

    • updateTargetAssets

      void updateTargetAssets(BaseSyncAsset[] updatedTargetAssets)
      Updates already existing entries for assets on the synchronization target.

      Updating entries is only called for already existing assets on both sides (Smint.io + sync target). However, no information is available which data of an asset has changed. Hence implementing classes should check binaries for changes, too - based on the version number of the binary (see ISmintIoBinary.getVersion()).

      Parameters:
      updatedTargetAssets - the list of updates, existing assets to create on the sync target. Ignore in case the list is empty ore null.

    • importNewTargetCompoundAssets

      void importNewTargetCompoundAssets(BaseSyncAsset[] newTargetCompoundAssets)
      Creates new entries for assets on the synchronization target.

      Creating new entries is only called for new assets available on the Smin.io platform but not yet on the sync target. Implementing classes can be sure, these items do not exist yet and do not need to perform any checks for duplicates.

      If the target DAM does not support compound assets, then throw an UnsupportedOperationException with message "Not supported". Additionally you should set proper capabilities in getCapabilities(). The the capabilities omit support for compound assets, then this function will never be called as compound assets will be ignored.

      Parameters:
      newTargetCompoundAssets - the list of new compound assets to create on the sync target. Ignore in case the list is empty ore null.

    • updateTargetCompoundAssets

      void updateTargetCompoundAssets(BaseSyncAsset[] updatedTargetCompoundAssets)
      Updates already existing entries for compound assets on the synchronization target.

      Updating entries is only called for already existing assets on both sides (Smint.io + sync target). However, no information is available which data of an asset has changed. Hence implementing classes should check binaries for changes, too - based on the version number of the binary (see ISmintIoBinary.getVersion()).

      If the target DAM does not support compound assets, then throw an UnsupportedOperationException with message "Not supported". Additionally you should set proper capabilities in getCapabilities(). The the capabilities omit support for compound assets, then this function will never be called as compound assets will be ignored.

      Parameters:
      updatedTargetCompoundAssets - the list of updates, existing assets to create on the sync target. Ignore in case the list is empty ore null.

    • afterAssetsSync

      void afterAssetsSync()
      After the synchronization of all assets this is called, but before afterAssetsSync().

      Any exception thrown will indicate a faulty ending, immediately aborting the overall synchronization without calling afterSync(). So make sure all exceptions to be ignored are caught within the task.

    • handleAuthenticatorException

      void handleAuthenticatorException(SmintIoAuthenticatorException exception)
      Is called in case an Smint.io API authentication exception has occurred.

      This function is the final call after an authentication exception occurred. No recovery is possible. The idea is, to perform some clean-up and notify the user or the system administrator, that an exception has occurred. After that, the synchronizing is terminated immediately.

      Authentication to the Smint.io API is performed right before the start of the synchronization process. In case an error occurs, authorization is re-tried a second time. So most of the time authentication exceptions happen there. Nevertheless in theory it is possible that the authentication becomes invalid due to session timeout after a long pause. Then a refresh of the authentication token is tried. In the event that re-authentication fails, this function is called in the course of a running synchronization process. So you never know, when shit happens. Nevertheless, since synchronization is no task with big pauses or rest periods, the authenticated session should not expire easily and thus most of the time this exception will occur right at the start of the sync process.

      Parameters:
      exception - the exception that has been caught in the synchronization process. The handler might take advantage of more information about the exception to handle.

    • handleSyncJobException

      void handleSyncJobException(SmintIoSyncJobException exception)
      Is called in case any exception in the course of synchronizing occurs, besides an authentication exception.

      This function is the final call after any exception occurred. No recovery is possible. The idea is, to perform some clean-up and notify the user or the system administrator, that an exception has occurred. After that, the synchronizing is terminated immediately.

      Whenever any of the synchronization functions (like importNewTargetAssets(BaseSyncAsset[])) throws an exception, synchronization is terminated immediately. Eventually this function is called. So in case of any exception, this handler is the final chance to perform clean-up and prepare everything for the next run to work better.

      Parameters:
      exception - the exception that has been caught in the synchronization process. The handler might take advantage of more information about the exception to handle.

    • afterSync

      void afterSync()
      A hook to be called after all synchronization took place.

      After all synchronization took place, some clean-up might be necessary. This is executed after all synchronization has ended.

      Any exception thrown will indicate a faulty ending, immediately aborting the overall synchronization. Since this is the last task to perform at the end of the synchronization, this might be negligible.
